intro: Bystropogon canus, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and yellow-centered white flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, preferring well-drained soils. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its drought tolerance and attractive appearance. Bystropogon canus is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
